{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of difficulty discarding items, distress associated with discarding items, and the accumulation of possessions that clutter living areas, causing significant distress and impairment in her functioning, are indicative of hoarding disorder. This disorder is often resistant to treatment, and when first-line treatment with cognitive-behavioral therapy is ineffective, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) can be considered. Fluoxetine is an SSRI that can be used in this context.", "answer_choice": "A"}
